answers.answer: I suggest you see a Vascular MD

Hello!Check your blood haemoglobin levels and rule out anemia. Check for any local infections, fractures.Rule out any recent injuries, fall etc.Rule out diabetes by a fasting blood sugar test. Rule out conditions such as arthritis.Rule out peripheral blood disorders and conditions such as deep vein thrombosis.Take care!

question: Im 41 and for the past 6mths or so my legs and ankels swell up really bad and will sometimes last for days and then sometimes they are fine. but in the past couple months my calf are very sore to the touch or if i flex my feet towards my body I dont feel any knots and its not a stabbing pain they just seem to acke bad and and this never goes away also at times when I touch any part of my legs from top to bottem they are sore to touch even with lil presure
title: Sore to the touch
